name: Chelicerae
description: The Chelicerae is a large, cunning aberration that utilizes its magical prowess and stealth to trap and poison foes. It features notable physical strength and intelligence, indicated by its sinister appearance.
memorable: It possesses a unique ability to siphon magic from spellcasters, diminishing their abilities while enhancing its own.
goals: To trap, poison, and drain the powers of its enemies for its own sinister motives.
relations: Often operates independently, but may be encountered alongside other creatures of evil nature.
environment: Typically found in dark, secluded places where it can ambush unwary travelers.
strengths: High Armor Class and Hit Points; advantage on saving throws against spells and magical effects; immunity to poison damage.
weaknesses: Relatively low movement speed compared to some other agile creatures.
attacks: The Chelicerae can deliver powerful melee attacks with its bite, which can poison targets, and claws along with a magical discharge that affects multiple foes.
most_powerful_ability: The ability to siphon magic from spellcasters, causing them significant disadvantage while regaining its spellcasting capability.
senses: Has darkvision out to 60 feet, allowing it to see in darkness.
skills: Excels in Acrobatics, Athletics, Stealth, and has good proficiency in Perception.
additional_information: Poison immunity and resistance to being charmed or poisoned.
Can traverse difficult surfaces and ceilings with ease.
Can cast spells for tactical advantages including buff spells like haste or methods to incapacitate enemies.
Exceptional Strength and Intelligence scores enhance physical and magical attacks.
Uses stealth and agility in combat for an ambush-style approach.
spellcasting: Can cast spells like *mage hand* and *invisibility*, enhancing its versatility in encounters.
test_queries: cunning large monster with magical powers
large creature that climbs walls and ceilings
stealthy aberration known for ambush tactics
evil aberration with powerful bite attack
